name: Myrtle and Olive 100% Cashmere Neckwarmer
description:
The artist Max Escher inspired this design, simple stripes that progress from one main colour to another. These neckwarmer are one-off,  hand knit by me using 100% cashmere
The two colours are:
Stripe 1: Myrtle
Stripe 2: Olive

This design was my first ever design for my etsy shop back in 2005. The neckwarmers are perfect for bridging seasonal changes, that little bit of extra warmth.

The final image shows another version being worn

Care: handwash in cool water, do not tumble dry

name: A stash bag for your knits
description:
Natural Cotton drawstring bag
SIZE: 25cm (w) x 35cm (h)

This bag has been screenprinted in a collaboration by http://skeinqueen.etsy.com and me - we use them for our kits we design and create but we have a small number spare which you can buy and fill with treats for a knitty friend or yourself.

These bags are perfect for WIP bags or to give a completed project as a gift in, or even just fill with your favourite fibre treats.

name: Blackbirds Beak Yellow and Green Original Shortie Sleeve Extenders
description:
The artist Max Escher inspired this design, simple stripes that progress from one main colour to another. These long sleeve extenders are one-off, knit by me using hand dyed yarn

This design was my first ever design for my etsy shop back in 2005. The sleeve extenders are perfect for bridging seasonal changes, that little bit of extra warmth

Shortie Sleeve Extenders
Length: 24cms/ 9.5 inches
19cms/7.5 inches wide 

Long armwarmers 100% wool, hand dyed in Thatcham UK by http://skeinqueen.co.uk
Handknit and designed in Reading, UK by me

Care: handwash in cool water, do not tumble dry

Please note, last image is not these gloves but a photo showing the fit (raspberry and oatmeal shorties, grey and pewter long)

description:
The artist Max Escher inspired this design, simple stripes that progress from one main colour to another. These neckwarmer are one-off, knit by me using 100% organic merino
The two colours are:
Stripe 1: Nettle and Cochineal
Stripe 2: Lichen

The yarn is hand dyed using plants by Elisabeth Beverley in Ashampstead, UK

This design was my first ever design for my etsy shop back in 2005. The neckwarmers are perfect for bridging seasonal changes, that little bit of extra warmth.

Care: handwash in cool water, do not tumble dry

name: Alfredo Gloves - PDF Pattern
description:
This pattern is inspired by my trips to visit my parents in Portugal, where I knit with my mum. I am inspired by the tilework, the colours on the exteriors of the buildings and my camera and sketchbook are always full of different architectural delights and the patterns. I made my first pair of Alfredos after being inspired on the very day that I first saw Restaurante Alfredo

Recommended Yarn:
The yarn is hand dyed by Skein Queen, Squash, fingering/ 4ply (14 wpi) UK merino yarn, dyed in the UK. Machine wash on cool cycle
http://skeinqueen.co.uk

This pattern is suitable for beginner- intermediate knitters, wanting to start with colourwork.
Skills:
Chart reading
Knitting in the round using either Magic Loop or DPN’s
Stranded knitting

Finished Size:
(xs) 16.5cms/ 6.5 inches long and 13cms/5-5.5 inches wide,
(s) 19cms/ 7.5 inches long and 15-16cms/6.-6.5 inches wide,
(m) 21.5cms/ 8.5 inches long and 16-17cms/6.5-7 inches wide,
(l) 23cms/ 9 inches long and 19-20cms/7.5 - 8 inches wide

To determine your size, wrap a flexible tape measure around the knuckles of your dominant hand, excluding the thumb, and find the circumference

Gauge, stocking st unblocked following the chart in the round = 2” / 5cm
(xs) 22sts / 22 rows (s) 20 sts / 20 rows
(m) 18 sts / 18 rows (l) 16 sts / 16 rows

Needles and notions:
(xs) 2mm for edging, 2.5mm (s) 2.25mm for edging, 2.75mm
(m) 2.5mm for edging, 3mm (l) 2.75mm for edging, 3.25mm
This pattern is knit on a circular needle using the Magic Loop technique. You can alternatively use either the 2 circular needle method or set of 5 DPN’s.
Blunt tapestry needle
Marker (pm)
Scrap yarn

Yarn
(xs) MC 18g/80yds CC 15g/ 65yds (s) MC 20g/88yds CC 16g/70yds
(m) MC 23g/100yds CC 20g/88yds (l) MC 25g/105yds CC 23g/100yds

The pattern is a 4 page PDF, one page of which is a colour chart

name: anarchy in the UK handwarmers - PDF Pattern
description:
These gloves were originally hand knitted by me from my own pattern whilst listening all the while to my Fidelity old record player. These Union Jack gloves are a homage to The Sex Pistols, Johnny Rotten and God Save the Queen (the record). You can re-create (with or without the soundtrack) using the pattern I have written. 

Pattern includes charts and knit support.

Recommended Yarn:
Blissful, 100% superwash BFL (Blue Faced Leicester) 4-ply sock
The yarn is hand dyed by Skein Queen in the UK.http://skeinqueen.co.uk.
The hand dyed yarn will have variations but we love that for our complete glove anarchy.

Recommended commercial yarn
Debbie Bliss, Rialto 4 ply or any equivalent.

This pattern is suitable for intermediate – experienced knitters.
Skills:
Chart reading
Knitting in the round
Magic Loop/ DPN’s
Working with three colours

Finished Size:
(S) 18cms/7 inches wide 
(M) 18cms/7.5 inches wide 
(L) 20.5cms/ 8 inches wide 

These gloves are completely thumb-less.

This pattern is knit on 3.00mm 
circular needle using the Magic Loop 
technique. You can alternatively use 
either the 2 circular needle method 
or set of 5 DPN’s.

name: Snooks- fingerless mitts or fliptop mitts PDF Pattern
description:
I wanted to make some gloves from Olive Snooks yarn (hand dyed by Skein Queen) ever since I saw it in someone else’s stash, I had been itching to knit something with it and in my head I could see what it was. The colourway is from a series of yarns created by Skeinqueen, inspired by Pushing Daisies TV series. The fairisle pattern is almost a circle that shifts along on each repeat. The pattern is knit in the contrast colour yarn and the thumb has a different pattern. In my head I was thinking of Olive Snook, circles, strange quirks and sunny days

The pattern includes instructions on making mittens, flip top mittens or handwarmers plus knit support.

Recommended Yarn:
The yarn is hand dyed by Skein Queen, Squash, fingering/ 4ply (14 wpi) UK merino yarn, dyed in the UK. Machine wash on cool cycle

This pattern is suitable for intermediate knitters.
Skills required: Chart reading, Knitting in the round, Magic Loop/ DPN’s, Stranded knitting

Finished Size:
(s) 18cms/6.5 inches wide
(m)19cms/7.5 inches wide
(l) 20.5cms/8 inches wide

To determine your size, wrap a flexible tape measure around the knuckles of your dominant hand, excluding the thumb, and find the circumference
For smaller and larger sizes, use the needles as listed below.

Needles and notions:
(m) 2.5mm for edging, 3mm
This pattern is knit on a circular needle using the Magic Loop technique. You can alternatively use either the 2 circular needle method or set of 5 DPN’s..
Blunt tapestry needle
Marker (pm)
Scrap yarn
Yarn
Handwarmers
(s) MC 20g/ 88yds CC 14g/ 62yds
(m) MC 23g/ 100 yds CC 15g/ 65yds
(l) MC 25g/105 yds CC 16g/70yds
Flip top mittens
(s) MC 30g/ 122yds CC 18g/ 90yds
(m) MC 34g/ 150 yds CC 23g/ 100yds
(l) MC 38g/160 yds CC 23g/100yds

name: mis-matched mittens
description:
A perfectly imperfect pair of mittens. 
Made from self-striping yarn and especially made so they don't match, these mis-matched mitts will be suitable for any quirky people. Sizemedium adult.
100% merino yarn, handknit by me to my original pattern

Hand knit and designed in Reading UK

name: Sage Green and Chocolate Original Shortie Armwarmers
description:
The artist Max Escher inspired this design, simple stripes that progress from one main colour to another. These shortie sleeve extenders are one-off, knit by me using 85% cotton, 10% silk, 5% cashmere

The sage green starts at the fingers and ends with the chocolate brown colour

This design was my first ever design for my etsy shop back in 2005. The sleeve extenders are perfect for bridging seasonal changes, that little bit of extra warmth.

name: Anarchy in the UK, Johnny Rotten Handwarmers Kit
description:
A complete kit ready for you to make your own Johnny Rotten Handwarmers.

These gloves were originally hand knitted by Alabama Whirly from her own pattern whilst listening all the while to her Fidelity old record player. These Union Jack gloves are a homage to The Sex Pistols, Johnny Rotten and God Save the Queen (the record).

The kit comprises of 25g of Rebel Red, 25g of Naked Anarchy and 25g Bolshy Blue hand dyed by Skein Queen and a full colour pattern including charts to make your own Johnny Rotten Handwarmers all in a fairtrade newspaper bag for complete anarchy.

The yarn is Blissful, 4 ply sockweight yarn (approx. 14 wpi), 100% Blue Faced Leicester, bred, spun and dyed in the UK, machine wash on cool cycle.

This pattern is suitable for intermediate – experienced knitters.
Skills:
Chart reading
Suitable for Knitting in the round or flat
Magic Loop/ DPN’s
Working with three colours
Stranded knitting
intarsia

Finished Size:
(s) 19.5cms/7.5 inches long and 18cms/7 inches wide
(m) 20.5cms/8 inches long and 18cms/7.5 inches wide
(l) 23cms/9 inches long and 18cms/8 inches wide

This pattern is knit flat but it is easy to knit in the round on a circular needle using the Magic Loop technique. You can alternatively use either the 2 circular needle method or set of 5 DPN’s. Please note that the kit DOES NOT contain needles.

The pattern is a two pages printed both sides in full colour and includes colour chart.

Yarn colours may vary slightly but will always be red, white and blue

name: Eternal Mistletoe for the Perpetually Hopeful Greeting Card
description:
The image is of knitted mistletoe "Eternal Mistletoe for ThePerpetually Hopeful' that I designed and made and is printed using archival inks by a professional printer on card.

The cards are printed on an FSC certified stock. They're satin coated on the outside for better colour reproduction, and the inside is left uncoated for you to write a message.

On the reverse of each card is a free pattern link to download a pattern for you to knit your own mistletoe
This listing is for one card

Card measures 10cms x 14.5cms.
The card is blank inside for your own personal message.

The cards will be dispatched in a stiffened mailer and is wrapped in cellophane.

name: PDF Pattern: Eternal Mistletoe for the Perpetually Hopeful
description:
A simple pattern starting with one leaf, working towards an i-cord stem then knitting another leaf and joining stems together. Instructions include instructions on creating berries by simple stitching.

You can build up as many stems as you wish, the pattern is worked in 4 ply but any yarn and appropriate needle would work.

The pattern can be created with any small amount of yarn and at any gauge.

After payment, a pdf file will be e-mailed to you with full, detailed instructions and email support.

This pattern is an original, copyrighted design. Please do not reproduce or distribute.

By buying this pattern you agree to print and use this pattern only for your personal non-commercial use and you may not sell any items produced using this pattern.

Suitable for beginners

name: Eschers - Filling the Gaps
description:
This listing is for the PDF Pattern only


The artist Max Escher inspired this pattern, simple stripes that progress from one main colour to another.

This design was my first ever design for my etsy shop back in 2005 and now available as a pattern that includes instructions for making both shortie and long sleeve extenders plus a neck cowl.

The sleeve extenders and neckwarmer are perfect for bridging seasonal changes, that little bit of extra warmth.

Pattern has three options - neckwarmer, shortie sleeve extenders and long sleeve extenders. The sleeve extenders are in 3 sizes, the neckwarmer is one size only.

Shortie Sleeve Extenders
Length: 24cms/ 9.5 inches
(s) 18cms/7 inches wide, (m) 19cms/7.5 inches wide, (l) 21cms/8.25 inches wide

Long Sleeve Extenders
Length: 35.5cms / 14 inches
(s) 18cms/7 inches wide, (m) 19cms/7.5 inches wide, (l) 21cms/8.25 inches wide

Neckwarmer (one size only)
Circumference 60cms/24 inches, depth 24cms/ 9.5 inches

Grey and Raspberry neckwarmers, shorties and long sleeve extenders samples knit in Lotus Yarns 100% Mongolian Cashmere DK, http://skeinqueenshop.co.uk
Navy neckwarmer sample knit in Debbie Bliss Rialto
Shortie Sleeve Extenders – approx 60 yds of each colour
Long Sleeve Extenders – approx 98 yds of each colour
Neckwarmer – approx 110 yds of each colour

After payment, a pdf file will be e-mailed to you with full, detailed instructions including chart and email support.

This pattern is an original, copyrighted design. Please do not reproduce or distribute.

By buying this pattern you agree to print and use this pattern only for your personal non-commercial use and you may not sell any items produced using this pattern.

Suitable for beginners

name: Saltire Mitt PDF Pattern
description:
THIS LISTING IS FOR THE PATTERN ONLY, NOT THE GLOVES

* * * * * * *

Saltire Mitts
Inspired by Scotland
I love playing with everyday things and suddenly seeing
them as something else. The Saltire works perfectly as
a mitten pattern. These mittens are knitted flat, using
intarsia. The hand-dyed yarn if you choose to buy it will have variations but we love that for our complete glove anarchy!

Recommended Yarn:
The yarn is hand dyed by Skein Queen, Desire, DK / 8 ply (11 wpi) 100% merino, DK weight yarn, dyed in the UK, machine wash on cool cycle
The hand dyed yarn will have variations but we love that for our complete glove anarchy.
http://skeinqueen.co.uk

This pattern is knit flat, cuff up and the colourwork is worked intarsia.
This pattern is suitable for intermediate knitters.
Skills:
Chart reading
Intarsia

Finished Size:
(s) 23cms/ 9 inches long and 15-16cms/6.-6.5 inches wide,
(m) 25.5cms/ 10 inches long and 16-17cms/6.5-7 inches wide,
(l) 28cms/11 inches long and 19-20cms/7.5 - 8 inches wide

Gauge, stocking st unblocked following the chart in the round = 2” / 5cm
(s) 14 sts / 14 rows (m) 13 sts / 13 rows (l) 12 sts / 12 rows

Needles and notions:
3.5mm for rib, 4mm for body
Blunt tapestry needle
Marker (pm)
Scrap yarn

Yarn:
MC (Saltire Blue) CC(white)
(s) A 32g/79yds, B 32g/79yds, C 28g/70yds (m) A 35g/88yds, B 35g/88yds, C 3

The pattern is a three page PDF, first page contains colour image banner and final page is colour chart.

This pattern is an original, copyrighted design. Please do not reproduce or distribute.

By buying this pattern you agree to print and use this pattern only for your personal non-commercial use and you may not sell any items produced using this pattern.

name: Johnny Rotten Anarchy Mittens
description:
PDF Pattern

THIS LISTING IS FOR THE PATTERN

Johnny Rotten Anarchy Mitts
These gloves were originally hand knitted by Alabama Whirly from her own pattern whilst listening all the while to her Fidelity old record player. These Union Jack gloves are a homage to The Sex Pistols, Johnny Rotten and God Save the Queen (the record).

Recommended Yarn:
The yarn is hand dyed by Skein Queen, Desire, DK / 8 ply (11 wpi) 100% merino, DK weight yarn, dyed in the UK, machine wash on cool cycle
The hand dyed yarn will have variations but we love that for our complete glove anarchy.
http://skeinqueen.co.uk

This pattern is suitable for intermediate – experienced knitters.
Skills:
Chart reading
Knitting in the round
Magic Loop/ DPN’s
Working with three colours
Stranded knitting

Finished Size:
(s) 23cms/ 9 inches long and 15-16cms/6.-6.5 inches wide,
(m) 25.5cms/ 10 inches long and 16-17cms/6.5-7 inches wide,
(l) 28cms/11 inches long and 19-20cms/7.5 - 8 inches wide

Gauge, stocking st unblocked following the chart in the round = 2” / 5cm
(s) 14 sts / 14 rows (m) 13 sts / 13 rows (l) 12 sts / 12 rows

Needles and notions:
(s) 3mm for edging, 3.5mm (m) 3.5mm for edging, 4mm (l) 4mm for edging, 4.5mm

This pattern is knit on a circular needle using the Magic Loop technique. You can alternatively use either the 2 circular needle method or set of 5 DPN’s. If you prefer to work flat on straight needles, it is possible to modify this pattern to suit
Blunt tapestry needle
Marker (pm)
Scrap yarn

Yarn:
Johnny Rotten Mitts (3 colour) A (red) B (blue) C (white)
(s) A 32g/79yds, B 32g/79yds, C 28g/70yds (m) A 35g/88yds, B 35g/88yds, C 30g/75yds (l) A 39g/98yds, B 39g/98yds, C 32g/79yds
Anarchy Mitts Yarn (2 colour) A (anarchy) B (white)
(s) MC 36g/88yds, CC 28g/70yds (m) MC 40g/100yds CC 30g/75yds (l) MC 44g/108yds CC 32g/79yds

The pattern is a four page PDF, first page contains colour image banner and final page is colour chart.

name: Mad Mabel Sock Blocker
description:
Mad Mabel sock blockers are made from 4mm laser cut acrylic from Mad Mabel’s own design.

Mad Mabel is a collaboration between myself and my hubby (Simon)

Each blocker has a handy knitting needle gauge in mm, and the largest hole at the top is perfect for hanging your blockers up. The gauge ranges in size from 2mm to 15mm.

These blockers will never warp or splinter on to your lovely handmade socks.

The medium size works with UK shoe size 5-8, US 7-9(Men's 5.5 to 7.5), Europe 37 to 41 (approx 9 inches across foot)

name: Johnny Rotten Mitten Kit
description:
A complete kit ready for you to make your own Johnny Rotten Mittens (all you need to supply is the needles and the ability to knit).

These gloves were originally hand knitted by Alabama Whirly from her own pattern whilst listening all the while to her Fidelity old record player. These Union Jack gloves are a homage to The Sex Pistols, Johnny Rotten and God Save the Queen (the record).

The kit comprises of 50g of Rebel Red, 50g of Naked Anarchy and 50g Bolshy Blue hand dyed by Skein Queen and a full colour pattern including charts to make your own Johnny Rotten Mittens all in a stash bag.
There is sufficient yarn in the kits to make even the largest size and have some left over for matching wristbands maybe?

The yarn is Desire, DK / 8 ply (11 wpi) 100% merino, dyed in the UK, machine wash on cool cycle.http://skeinqueen.co.uk

This pattern is suitable for intermediate – experienced knitters.
Skills:
Chart reading
Knitting in the round
Magic Loop/ DPN’s
Working with three colours
Stranded knitting

Finished Size:
(s) 23cms/ 9 inches long and 15-16cms/6.-6.5 inches wide,
(m) 25.5cms/ 10 inches long and 16-17cms/6.5-7 inches wide,
(l) 28cms/11 inches long and 19-20cms/7.5 - 8 inches wide

This pattern is knit on a circular needle using the Magic Loop technique. You can alternatively use either the 2 circular needle method or set of 5 DPN’s. If you prefer to work flat on straight needles, it is possible to modify this pattern to suit

The pattern is a four page PDF, first page contains colour image banner and final page is colour chart.
